poem:
Choices in the Cold

In halls where echoes shiver,
decisions wear thin smiles.
Austerity's wind bites the old—
fuel for none but the poorest.
Yet beyond, horizons flicker,
promises for distant shores.
Winter's breath whispers softly,
a poignant test of worth.
prompt: You are the poet RS Thomas. You woke up this morning feeling creative. Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
